item.title: Marissa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All good books are alike in that they are truer than if they had really happened and after you are finished reading one you will feel that all that happened to you and afterwards it all belongs to you: the good and the bad, the ecstasy, the remorse and sorrow, the people and the places and how the weather was. If you can get so that you can give that to people, then you are a writer." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Isn't it pretty to think so." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "If people bring so much courage to this world the world has to kill them to break them, so of course it kills them. The world breaks every one and afterward many are strong at the broken places. But those that will not break it kills. It kills the very good and the very gentle and the very brave impartially. If you are none of these you can be sure it will kill you too but there will be no special hurry." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last it and not be smashed by it." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "As a writer, you should not judge, you should understand." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Marissa add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "A man of genius makes no mistakes. His errors are volitional and are the portals of discovery." -- James Joyce

item.title: Marissa add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "But my body was like a harp and her words and gestures were like fingers running upon the wires." -- James Joyce

item.title: Marissa add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Why is it that words like these seem dull and cold? Is it because there is no word tender enough to be your name?" -- James Joyce

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Edgar Allen Poe
item.description: "We loved with a love that was more than love." -- Edgar Allen Poe

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "We love the things we love for what they are." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can warm me, I know that is poetry. If I feel physically as if the top of my head were taken off, I know that is poetry. These are the only ways I know it. Is there any other way?" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "In the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself." -- Albert Einstein
